results.title: Kalash: the last pagans
results.creator_credit: David O'Brien, Bob Lagettie, Norm Wilkinson and Chateau Productions International
results.brief_description: The last of the pagan religions, the Kalash, reside in the Hindu Kush mountains in North West Pakistan. Once great in number, they have now depleted to 2,000 because of the encroachment of civilization and pressure from religion such as Islam. This program looks at their attitude toward life, death, marriage, maturity, women, nature and sacrifice. It also suggests that the Kalash are direct descendants of Alexander the Great, whose soldiers occupied the region where the remaining Kalash live, during an invasion in the 4th century. Narrated by Brian Harrison.

results.title: Spirit of the railway
results.brief_description: This moving documentary provides a personal journey through one of the most significant events in Australia’s history; the construction of the Thai-Burma railway. The railway was built by Australian prisoners of war and other allied and Asian laboueres during World War 2. The video uses personal accounts, forensic and historical footage, most of which hasn’t been seen in America, Australia or Japan. Features artwork by Ronald Searle, Jack Chalker, Ray Parkin and Fred Ransom-Smith.

results.title: The Hemp revolution
results.creator_credit: Anthony Clarke, Video Vision and Conscious Light
results.brief_description: This documentary proposes that the Hemp plant (Cannabis Sativa Marijuana) could be the solution to several of our major environmental problems. It would meen a shift from the present unsustainable, petrochemical-based economy towards a sustainable plant based economy. A move which could only occur if the drug was legalized. This programme covers the history and varied usage of the plant as well as alternative options in response to the “war on drugs”. Interviews feature Dr Andrew Weil, Dr Lester Grinspoon, Terence McKenna, Dr Kate Short, Professor Peter Dale Scott, Dr Andrew Katelaris and Gatewood Galbraith.

results.title: Game girls: Heathens
results.brief_description: This tape contains two short documentaries about the culture surrounding football. “Game girls” (directed by Miriam Cannell), follows the role of women in Australian football and the often silent but loudly significant role they have played. Rated PG. “Heathens” (directed by Megan Spencer), confirms that there are really passionate and vitriolic supporters out there as director Megan Spencer follows St Kilda supporters with names like Thommo and Chook. Watch out for the language, which is alot more colourful than the red white and black. Rated R, for reasons which become very apparent from the first five seconds.

results.title: Pretty as a picture: the art of David Lynch
results.creator_credit: Toby Keeler and Fine Cut Presentations
results.brief_description: Using a behind the scenes look at the production of David Lynch’s ‘Lost highway’, this documentary looks at the auteur who brought us ‘Eraserhead’ (307091), ‘Elephant man’ (302534), ‘Blue velvet (302912), and the television series ‘Twin peaks’. He discusses his inspiration, impressions of his first film, and his drive for creative expression. Interviews are presented with actors who have starred in Lynchs’ films, relatives, and production crew. They include; Bill Pullman, Patricia Arquette, Mel Brooks, Jack Frisk, Barry Gifford, Jennifer Lynch, Jack Nance, Mary Sweeney and Dean Stockwell.

results.title: Hitler: the final chapter
results.creator_credit: Cyril Jones and Cyril Jones and Associates
results.brief_description: One of the most discussed questions in history, “what really happened to Hitler?” is the subject of this investigative documentary, written and produced by Cyril Jones. He uses footage obtained from the Russian Film Archives to support his case as well as the testimony of Elena Rjeveskaia, last surviving member of the SMERSH team. The documentary also covers the fate of Hitler’s chosen successor, Dr Joseph Goebbels, and his family.

results.title: Tweekage
results.brief_description: Skateboard enthusiasts will enjoy this hour of footage recording some of Australia’s top skaters performing impressive moves; kick flipping, sliding and grinding across Sydney, Melbourne, the Gold Coast and major skating events. For those of you who don’t skate you may be inspired to give it a try, although the SLAM section illustrates that even professionals are prone to hurting themselves. Good camera work puts the viewer right into the heart of the action and provides an adrenaline rush.

results.title: Sunrise: awakening = Tjintu-pakani (A) (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Andre Reese and Australia Council. Aboriginal Arts Board
results.brief_description: Depicts a six-week long Aboriginal theatre workshop at the Black Theatre Arts and Culture Centre in Redfern, Sydney that culminates in a first performance for most of the participants. Highlights the dignity and growing self-image of those who participated. Suitable for secondary level. Performers include Andrew Jackomos.

results.title: The Celluloid closet
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Friedman, Rob Epstein and Reflective Image
results.brief_description: Vito Russo’s seminal text on homosexual representation in Hollywood cinema has been faithfully adapted for the screen by Rob Epstein and Jeffrey Friedman who also made the documentaries” The Times of Harvey Milk” and “Common threads: Stories from the quilt”. Narrated by Lily Tomlin and featuring interviews with Susan Sarandon, Gore Vidal, Tom Hanks, Quentin Crisp, Tony Curtis, Harvey Fierstein, Whoopi Goldberg, Susi Bright, Richard Dyer and Amistad Maupin (who also wrote Lily Tomlin’s voice over narration), “The Celluloid closet” covers ambitious ground, that being Hollywoods difficult relationship with showing homosexual desire openly and honestly. This informative documentary also demonstrates how certain films were modified through such means as the puritanical Hayes code which was set up to stamp out any hint of ‘sexual perversion’ from the screen. The film also goes on to discuss how homosexuality was then coded and subverted in order to pass unnoticed by the censors. Featuring clips from “Ben Hur”, “Johnny Guitar”, “Calamity Jane”, “The Childrens Hour”, “Boys in the band”, “Tea and Sympathy”, “Suddenly last summer”, “Some like it hot”, “Rebel without a cause”, “Personal best” and “Cruising”.

results.title: Raging planet: earthquake: volcano
results.creator_credit: David Hutt, Richard Burke-Ward, Discovery Communications and Pioneer Productions
results.brief_description: Raging planet is a series which explores nature at its most hazardous and with the use of brilliant cinematography allows the viewer to be face to face with the violent forces of nature. This installment looks at the effect of earthquakes on California, Tokyo, South China and Mexico City, on buildings, livestock and humans. It also visits volcanoes that have created havoc in the world and talks briefly about predicting disasters and how they have proven true in the past. Originally screened on Discovery channel.
